annotation.text: we used a polyclonal anti-TRPC7 antibody raised to the extreme C-terminus [15] to assess distribution in a rat pituitary cell line, GH4C1. Consistent with the perinuclear concentration in COS-7 cells expressing FLAG-hTRPC7, the endogenous protein was detected in a Golgi-like area close to the nucleus (Figure 4A).

we used a polyclonal anti-TRPC7 antibody raised to the extreme C-terminus [15] to assess distribution in a rat pituitary cell line, GH4C1. Consistent with the perinuclear concentration in COS-7 cells expressing FLAG-hTRPC7, the endogenous protein was detected in a Golgi-like area close to the nucleus (Figure 4A).

Consistent with the perinuclear concentration in COS-7 cells expressing FLAG-hTRPC7, the endogenous protein was detected in a Golgi-like area close to the nucleus (Figure 4A). Double-labelling experiments with the cis-Golgi marker alpha-mannosidase II indicate a high degree of co-localization although not complete overlap.

Consistent with the perinuclear concentration in COS-7 cells expressing FLAG-hTRPC7, the endogenous protein was detected in a Golgi-like area close to the nucleus (Figure 4A). Double-labelling experiments with the cis-Golgi marker alpha-mannosidase II indicate a high degree of co-localization although not complete overlap.
